metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7548 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PostgreSQL versions before 9.4.13, 9.5.8 and 9.6.4 are vulnerable to authorization flaw allowing remote authenticated attackers with no privileges on a large object to overwrite the entire contents of the object, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7548` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libecpg6 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpq5 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
